author: somnergy
content:
<@892053833121923094> 
Tests with `executionRequests` that look like
```
  [
      "0x03"
  ]
```
Should not expect block exception, as it has size=1, and thus gets -32602 InvalidParams error. When passed through `newPayloadV4`, it shouldn't be expected to be processed. Currently erigon is failing 10 such tests.
Further, there is no mention of unknown request types errors in the specs, if that was the purpose of some of these tests.
For instance, `tests/prague/eip7685_general_purpose_el_requests/test_request_types.py::test_invalid_request_type[fork_Prague-blockchain_test_engine--no_data-include_valid_requests_False]`

author: marioevz
content: If you are referring to the hive tests, these are outdated in the currently running version of hive and we have an open PR to address this right now: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1097

author: somnergy
content: Yes, Hive-EEST, that are present in the `blockchain_tests_engine` folder of the fixtures, and whose results are in https://hive.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/ . For some reason other clients may be passing these tests, I am not sure why.

author: marioevz
content: They will probably start failing once we update the tests
